thread.title: danjmartin published BBC Leicester's Lukwesa Baruk chosen as new presenter for Inside...
thread.title_full: danjmartin published BBC Leicester's Lukwesa Baruk chosen as new presenter for Inside...

author: danjmartin
title: danjmartin published BBC Leicester's Lukwesa Baruk chosen as new presenter for Inside...
text:
BBC Leicester's Lukwesa Baruk chosen as new presenter for Inside Out's 30th series By danjmartin   BBC Leicester's Lukwesa Baruk chosen as new presenter for Inside Out's 30th...   
The BBC has chosen a new presenter for its Inside Out East Midlands current affairs programme. 
The show returns on September 5 with BBC Radio Leicester presenter Lukwesa Burak at the helm. 
Lukwesa takes over from long-term presenter Marie Ashby. 
Lukwesa, who is originally from Zambia, has previously worked for East Midlands Today, Sky News, and Al Jazeera. 
The first show - at 7.30pm on BBC1 onMonday, will be a Brexit special examining at how the recent vote to leave the EU will affect communities and businesses across Leicestershire, Nottinghamshire and Derbyshire. 
David Holdsworth, controller of BBC English Regions, said: "It's a really proud moment to see Inside Out in its 30th series. 
"Since the first series aired in 2002 teams across the country have uncovered vital stories and explored the issues viewers care about in each region. 
"Our investigations have revealed some of the most shocking realities taking place on our doorsteps and triggered political change. They have brought people to account and changed lives. This could not be more important as we enter the 30th series of Inside Out."
